meanings.sent1: The room was decorated in various shades of noncolor.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to wear noncolors like white and gray.
meanings.sent3: The artist used noncolor to create a minimalist masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: In the painting, the noncolor symbolized emptiness and solitude.
meanings.sent5: The noncolor of the sky before sunrise was calming and serene.

meanings.definition: A color that is not vibrant or noticeable
meanings.sent1: The painting lacked depth due to the dominance of noncolor.
meanings.sent2: He chose a noncolor for the walls to keep the room subtle.
meanings.sent3: The noncolor of the dress made her blend into the background.
meanings.sent4: The noncolor of the desert sand seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent5: The noncolor of the old photograph gave it a nostalgic feel.
